info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 6:06PM EDT until August 11 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, North Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Red Hill, Myrtle Beach Airport, Socastee, Little River, Cherry Grove Inlet, Little River Entrance, Hickory Grove, Nixonville, Hand, Hammond, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach, Wampee, Forestbrook, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Coastal Carolina University and Longs. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING
